definition: wheel/disk/ring/steamship/to take turns/to rotate/by turn/classifier for big round objects: disk, or recurring events: round, turn

sentences.english: We took the children to the dock to see the ships.
sentences.chinese: 我们带孩子们到码头去看轮船。

sentences.english: An ancient Mediterranean seagoing vessel propelled by oars.
sentences.chinese: 一种古时在地中海内靠桨推进的远洋轮船。

sentences.english: The steamer will go west by north.
sentences.chinese: 这艘轮船将向西偏北方向航行。

sentences.english: The port near our city will be opened to foreign ships.
sentences.chinese: 我们城市附近的码头将为外国轮船开放。

sentences.english: The steamer Artic was wrecked at sea.
sentences.chinese: 阿替克轮船在海上失事。

sentences.english: Woolly and coarse, opossum is often used for liners and men's coats.
sentences.chinese: 羊毛和粗，负鼠通常用于轮船和男子的大衣。

sentences.english: It was a native boat that had an accident in the waters ahead.
sentences.chinese: 在前面水域失事的是一艘土籍轮船。

sentences.english: The steamer was beating along the coast.
This model ship is made by Uncle Wang.
sentences.chinese: 这个轮船模型是由王叔叔制作的。

sentences.english: They took up a berth near the harbor.
sentences.chinese: 一艘轮船在码头泊位停泊。

sentences.english: The heaving of the ship made her dizzy and she leanedagainst the handrail.
sentences.chinese: 轮船的起伏让她头晕眼花，她斜靠在扶手上。

sentences.english: A new ship set off from England to America on its first trip.
sentences.chinese: 一艘轮船从英国出发到美国，进行它的初航。

sentences.english: The ship contrasted with the blue sea.
sentences.chinese: 那轮船与蔚蓝的大海形成对照。

sentences.english: The steamer passed by steep hills and was close to the destination.
sentences.chinese: 轮船经过了陡峭的山峰并靠近目的地。
